revision.text:
'''Datameer, Inc.''', headquartered in [[San Mateo, California]], is a software development company.
Datameer specializes in analysis of large volumes of data<ref>{{cite web|url=http://radar.oreilly.com/2010/04/big-data-tool-for-business-analysts.html |title=''O'Reilly Radar, April 19, 2010 |publisher=Radar.oreilly.com |date=2010-04-19 |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref> for business users of Apache [[Hadoop]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hadoop.apache.org/ |title=Apache Hadoop |publisher=Hadoop.apache.org |date= |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref> The company's product, Datameer Analytics Solution (DAS), is a [[business integration]] platform for Hadoop and includes data source integration, an analytics engine with a spreadsheet interface designed for business users with over 200 analytic functions and visualization including reports, charts and dashboards. DAS is available for all major Hadoop distributions including [[Apache Software Foundation|Apache]], [[Cloudera]], EMC Greenplum HD, IBM BigInsights, MapR, [[Yahoo!]] and Amazon.
The company was founded in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rao |first=Leena |url=http://www.techcrunchit.com/2010/04/13/datameer-raises-2-5-million-for-apache-hadoop-based-analytics-platform/ |title=''TechCrunchIT'', April 14, 2010 |publisher=Techcrunchit.com |date=2010-04-13 |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Vance |first=Ashlee |url=http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/04/22/start-up-goes-after-big-data-with-hadoop-helper/?pagemode=prin |title=''The New York Times'', April 22, 2010 |publisher=Bits.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2010-04-22 |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref> Datameer announced the general availability of DAS in October 2010 and is currently on its Version 2.1 release.<ref>[http://www.datameer.com/blog/uncategorized/datameer-2-1-and-the-datameer-analytics-app-market-available-now.html Datameer Press Release, November 16, 2012]</ref>
Datameer was voted the second most promising [[cloud computing]] company at [[GigaOM]]'s Structure 2010 LaunchPad<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gigaom.com/2010/06/23/structure-2010-launchpad-cloudswitch-wins/ |title=''GigaOM'', June 23, 2010 |publisher=Gigaom.com |date=2010-06-23 |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref> and [[Information Today, Inc.|KMWorld]] named DAS a Trend-Setting Product of 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmworld.com/Articles/Editorial/Feature/KMWorld-Trend-Setting-Products-of-2010-69565.aspx |title=''KMWorld'', August 31, 2010 |publisher=Kmworld.com |date= |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref> Datameer has also been recognized as a Dow Jones VentureWire Start-Up to Watch.<ref>{{cite web|last=Capital |first=Venture |url=http://blogs.wsj.com/venturecapital/2010/10/12/venturewires-fastech-conference-to-spotlight-most-promising-start-ups/ |title=''The Wall Street Journal'', October 12, 2010 |publisher=Blogs.wsj.com |date=2010-10-12 |accessdate=2010-12-04}}</ref>
On May 16, 2011, Datameer announced a $9.25M B-financing round led by venture capital firm Kleiner Perkins, Caufield and Byers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://techcrunch.com/2011/05/16/kleiner-perkins-leads-9m-round-in-apache-hadoop-based-analytics-platform-datameer |title= Kleiner Perkins Leads 9M round In Apache Hadoop-Based Analytics Platform |publisher=www.techcrunch.com |date=2011-05-16 |accessdate=2011-06-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/external/venturebeat/2011/05/16/16venturebeat-datameer-snags-925m-more-to-analyze-massive-87546.html?partner=rss&emc=rss |title= Datameer Snags $9.25M More to Analyze Massive Amounts of Data |publisher=www.nytimes.com |date=2011-05-16 |accessdate=2011-06-04}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.datameer.com/ Datameer website]
